aiVerdicts.rationale: Electron provides the best balance of proven stability, rich native features (system tray, notifications, file dialogs), and maintainability for a Node/TypeScript team. While Tauri has superior bundle size, the Rust toolchain requirement and architectural complexity (Node sidecar) introduce unnecessary risk for a production migration tool. The 150MB bundle is acceptable for enterprise desktop utilities.
aiVerdicts.concerns: Monitor memory usage during large backup processing. Consider lazy-loading Electron modules. If bundle size becomes critical, revisit Tauri once the Rust/Node integration matures.

analysis.divergenceReason: Council values production stability and team maintainability over raw performance metrics. Rust toolchain requirement for Tauri adds barrier.

tradeoffs.deltaVsBeta: Delta has 30x smaller bundle but requires Rust expertise and sidecar architecture
tradeoffs.alphaVsBeta: Alpha is web-accessible but requires server infrastructure
tradeoffs.gammaVsBeta: Gamma is lightest but limited UX for complex error handling
